etymologies: early 17th century; earliest use found in William Sclater. From quaere. Compare earlier quaere, queer

definitions: To query; to question. Frequently with whether.

etymologies: mid 16th century; earliest use found in Thomas Phaer (?1510–1560), translator and physician. From classical Latin quaere, imperative singular of quaerere (in post-classical Latin also querere) to ask, inquire

definitions: Introducing a question or subject of enquiry: ask, inquire, query; ‘one may ask’, ‘it is a question’ (whether, etc.).
